oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Law offices; Lawyers; Judges
Bryan, William Jennings, 1860-1925; Evolution and anti-evolution; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Jennings Bryan and Judge John T. Raulston sit at a table together in an unidentified law office.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TSLA Staff
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bryan and Raulston were the prosecuting attorney and presiding judge, respectively, in the famed Scopes "Monkey" Trial. A deeply religious man, Raulston often quoted scripture during the trial and began each court session with a prayer.
